thread.title: City Manager Mike Kee planning to retire
thread.title_full: City Manager Mike Kee planning to retire

title: City Manager Mike Kee planning to retire
text: City Manager Mike Kee planning to retire City Manager Mike Kee planning to retire By Baker City Herald October 12, 2015 07:37 am Baker City Manager Mike Kee has asked the City Council to approve a proposal by which he will retire on Oct. 31, then be re-hired for a six-month contract starting Nov. 1. Keeâ€™s proposal would save the city approximately $2,000 per month in PERS contributions that it would not have to pay during the six-month period. The proposal would allow Kee to finish projects and give the City Council time to recruit his replacement. Councilors will consider Kee's proposal during their meeting Tuesday, which starts at 7 p.m. at City Hall, 1655 First St.
